headline: Cocoa Prices Rebound as ICE Inventories Fall
summary: December ICE NY cocoa (CCZ25 ) on Thursday closed up +14 (+0.23%), and December ICE London cocoa #7 (CAZ25 ) closed up +19 (+0.44%). Cocoa prices recovered from early losses on Thursday and settled higher as shrinking ICE cocoa inventories sparked short covering in cocoa futures. ICE-monitored cocoa inventories held...

headline: Gold demand spikes, weak Halloween candy sales weigh on Hershey
summary: Yahoo Finance host Josh Lipton recaps some of the top stories on Wall Street on Yahoo Finance's Market Minute, including Cigna (CI) warning investors about margin pressures, gold (GC=F) demand surging, and Hershey's (HSY) weak Halloween candy sales. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Hershey (HSY) Stock Trades Down, Here Is Why
summary: Shares of chocolate company Hershey (NYSE:HSY) fell 3.9% in the morning session after the company reported third-quarter results that, despite beating revenue expectations, showed a steep drop in profitability. Although sales grew by 6.5% year-on-year to $3.18 billion, the company's adjusted earnings per share fell by 44.4% to $1.30. Hershey's profits were squeezed by declining margins, with its gross margin falling 8.7 percentage points from the prior year due to higher input costs. The company

headline: Hershey Shares Slide Despite Strong Q3 Earnings and Revised Full-Year Guidance
summary: Hershey (NYSE: HSY) delivered a decisive earnings beat this morning, posting third-quarter results that significantly exceeded Wall Street expectations and prompted management to raise full-year guidance. The stock was up sharply in early trading on the strength of the numbers and the company’s improved outlook, but since the open, shares are down. Strong Execution Drives ... headline: Halloween Hasn’t Been Sweet for Candy Sales, Hershey Says
summary: Halloween candy sales are looking spooky—and not in a good way.  Hershey said Thursday that its Halloween sales have been disappointing thus far.  Hershey Chief Executive Kirk Tanner said that when Halloween falls on a Friday, roughly a third of the business is typically done the week of the holiday.

content.title: Halloween Hasn’t Been Sweet for Candy Sales, Hershey Says
content.summary: Halloween candy sales are looking spooky—and not in a good way.  Hershey said Thursday that its Halloween sales have been disappointing thus far.  Hershey Chief Executive Kirk Tanner said that when Halloween falls on a Friday, roughly a third of the business is typically done the week of the holiday.

headline: Hershey Warns of Weak Halloween Sales, Nudges Up Outlook
summary: Halloween made up nearly 18% of annual US candy sales across the industry in 2024, second only to Christmas.  “The season did get off to a slow start,” new Chief Executive Officer Kirk Tanner said of Halloween on a call with analysts Thursday.  The company said when Halloween falls on a Friday, about a third of sales occur during the final week — but acknowledged its holiday sales would be soft this season even if that happens.

content.title: Hershey Warns of Weak Halloween Sales, Nudges Up Outlook
content.summary: Halloween made up nearly 18% of annual US candy sales across the industry in 2024, second only to Christmas.  “The season did get off to a slow start,” new Chief Executive Officer Kirk Tanner said of Halloween on a call with analysts Thursday.  The company said when Halloween falls on a Friday, about a third of sales occur during the final week — but acknowledged its holiday sales would be soft this season even if that happens.

headline: Hershey (NYSE:HSY) Beats Q3 Sales Expectations
summary: Chocolate company Hershey (NYSE:HSY) reported revenue ahead of Wall Streets expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 6.5% year on year to $3.18 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.30 per share was 22.2% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Hershey (NYSE:HSY) Beats Q3 Sales Expectations
content.summary: Chocolate company Hershey (NYSE:HSY) reported revenue ahead of Wall Streets expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 6.5% year on year to $3.18 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.30 per share was 22.2% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Hershey beats Q3 expectations, raises full-year outlook
summary: Investing.com -- The Hershey Company (NYSE: HSY) reported third-quarter earnings that surpassed analyst expectations, with revenue climbing 6.5% to $3.18 billion compared to the consensus estimate of $3.11 billion. The chocolate and snack maker posted adjusted earnings per share of $1.30, beating the analyst forecast of $1.06.

content.title: Hershey beats Q3 expectations, raises full-year outlook
content.summary: Investing.com -- The Hershey Company (NYSE: HSY) reported third-quarter earnings that surpassed analyst expectations, with revenue climbing 6.5% to $3.18 billion compared to the consensus estimate of $3.11 billion. The chocolate and snack maker posted adjusted earnings per share of $1.30, beating the analyst forecast of $1.06.

headline: Hershey: Q3 Earnings Snapshot
summary: On a per-share basis, the Hershey, Pennsylvania-based company said it had profit of $1.36. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring gains, came to $1.30 per share. The results exceeded Wall Street expectations.

content.title: Hershey: Q3 Earnings Snapshot
content.summary: On a per-share basis, the Hershey, Pennsylvania-based company said it had profit of $1.36. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring gains, came to $1.30 per share. The results exceeded Wall Street expectations.
